It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant produces tiny, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
